message:
Merge pull request #9535 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 22:04 UTC
ai_summary: This commit modifies several documentation files related to Microsoft Entra ID Governance. Specifically, it updates the lifecycle workflow tasks documentation to reflect new parameters for the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task, including the ability to specify a delay before the assignments are removed. Additionally, it updates the PIM documentation, providing more clarity around assigning custom roles with administrative unit scopes, and modifies an image file related to risk-based policy impact.

author: rolyon
ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The changes include updating the task description to reflect new customization options in the Microsoft Entra admin center, such as specifying a delay for assignment removal.  Additionally, the commit provides more detail regarding the task parameters and example usage within a workflow, highlighting the "daysUntilExpiration" argument.  Finally, an image related to the task was also modified.

author: rolyon
message: Assign custom role with administrative unit scope
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "pim-how-to-add-role-to-user.md" document.  The changes update the date and refine the instructions for assigning roles scoped to administrative units. Specifically, it clarifies how to assign custom roles with administrative unit scope and provides updated links for further information.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9533 from OWinfreyATL/owinfreyATL-AccessPackageAssignmentBehavior-PublicPreview

Assignment package workflow Public Preview
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks in Microsoft Entra, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The changes include clarifying the task's customization options (name, description, and delayed removal), adding information about a "daysUntilExpiration" argument, and providing a more detailed example of how to use the task within a workflow using Microsoft Graph.  Additionally, there are no changes to the image file.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation for lifecycle workflow tasks, specifically focusing on the "Remove all access package assignments for user" task. The update adds a new line describing the arguments for this task, clarifying that it includes a "daysUntilExpiration" parameter with a corresponding value. This enhancement provides more detailed information about how to configure and utilize this particular workflow task.

author: Ortagus Winfrey
ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for lifecycle workflows related to removing all access package assignments for users. The changes include adding information about customizing the task to remove assignments immediately or after a delay and updating the example Microsoft Graph parameters to include a "daysUntilExpiration" parameter, indicating a potential new feature to delay the removal of access package assignments. Additionally, an image related to the "remove all user access package assignment task" was also modified.

message:
Merge pull request #9531 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-08-29 17:04 UTC
ai_summary: This commit updates multiple Microsoft Entra documentation files. Key changes include: updating links related to certificate revocation lists, introducing a new document about CRLs, reorganizing and updating information about certificate-based authentication, updating the documentation to include the new feature of CA Scoping, and updating documentation for auditing in Privileged Identity Management.  Additionally, there are minor updates to other documents.

author: James Barnett
message:
Merge pull request #9329 from vimrang/CRLChanges

creating new CRL page
ai_summary: This commit introduces significant updates related to Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) in Microsoft Entra ID's certificate-based authentication (CBA). It includes a new dedicated document explaining how CRLs work, how to configure revocation, and how to enforce CRL validation. Existing documents were updated to reference the new content and reflect changes to CRL-related features, while also renaming and moving associated image files.

author: vimrang
ai_summary: This commit modifies the documentation for certificate-based authentication in Microsoft Entra ID. It updates the document related to Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs), adding a minor edit to the section title "CRL error eeference" to "CRL error reference". This suggests a small correction or improvement in the documentation's organization or clarity.

ai_summary: This commit updates the documentation for Privileged Identity Management (PIM) audit logs. It adds two new images related to the audit logs and modifies the "how-to" guide. The changes clarify how to view resource and personal audit history, update the access requirements, and refine the descriptions of the audit features within PIM.

Update SQL Server version in prerequisites
ai_summary: This commit modifies the "How to connect install prerequisites" document for Microsoft Entra Connect. The changes include updating the document's last modified date, referencing a different URL for SQL Server TLS 1.2 support, and adjusting the list of installed SQL Server components to reflect the 2019 versions instead of the 2022 versions. The net effect is a minor content update to reflect more current versions of SQL Server and other links.
